Prediksi Musim Hujan dan Kemarau 2020, Apa Ada Anomali?
01 Nov 2019, 16:31 by Tim - detikInet


Foto: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - Musim hujan segera tiba. Beberapa wilayah sudah mengalami turunnya hujan meskipun belum konsisten. Nah, bagaimana serba-serbi musim hujan kali ini sekaligus perkiraan musim kemarau 2020?Menurut Badan Meteorologi, Klimatologi dan Geofisika (BMKG), wilayah Indonesia mengalami musim kemarau panjang di tahun 2019. Kondisi ini mengakibatkan kekeringan yang berdampak pada ketersediaan air bersih, kebakaran hutan dan lahan, serta suhu panas."Kondisi iklim di Indonesia sangat dikontrol oleh kondisi suhu muka air laut di Samudera Hindia sebelah Barat - Barat Daya Pulau Sumatera dan di Samudera Pasifik, serta di perairan laut Indonesia," tulis Kepala Badan Meteorologi Klimatologi dan Geofisika, Dwikorita Karnawati, di situs resmi BMKG.Fenomena yang saat ini sedang terjadi karena rendahnya suhu permukaan laut daripada suhu normalnya yang berkisar antara 26 - 27 derajat celcius di wilayah perairan Indonesia bagian selatan dan barat, sehingga berimplikasi pada kurangnya pembentukan awan di wilayah Indonesia.Dengan adanya fenomena tersebut, mengakibatkan awal musim hujan periode 2019/2020 mengalami kemunduran, dan sebagian besar wilayah Indonesia mulai memasuki musim hujan pada bulan November, kecuali untuk wilayah Sumatera dan Kalimantan yang dimulai sejak pertengahan Oktober 2019.Berdasarkan hasil monitoring dan analisa dinamika atmosfer, BMKG memprediksi bahwa pada tahun 2020 tidak terindikasi akan terjadi El- Nino kuat. NOAA dan NASA (Amerika) serta JAMSTEC (Jepang) pun memprediksi hasil yang serupa.(ke halaman selanjutnya) (fyk/fay)

Rainy and Dry Season Prediction 2020, Are There Anomalies?
Nov 1 2019, 16:31 by Team - detikInet


Photo: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - The rainy season is coming soon. Some areas have experienced rain, although it has not been consistent. Well, how about this rainy season sundries as well as the 2020 dry season forecast? According to the Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics Agency (BMKG), the Indonesian region experienced a long dry season in 2019. This condition resulted in a drought which affected the availability of clean water, forest fires and land, as well as hot temperatures. "The climatic conditions in Indonesia are highly controlled by the condition of sea surface temperatures in the West Indian Ocean - Southwest of Sumatra Island and in the Pacific Ocean, as well as in Indonesian sea waters," wrote the Head of the Meteorological Climatology and Geophysics Agency, Dwikorita Karnawati, on the official BMKG website. A phenomenon that is currently happening due to lower sea surface temperatures than normal temperatures ranging from 26-27 degrees Celsius in southern and western Indonesian waters, thus implicating for the lack of cloud formation in Indonesia. the existence of this phenomenon, resulting in the beginning of the rainy season 2019/2020 period This is a setback, and most parts of Indonesia began to enter the rainy season in November, except for Sumatra and Kalimantan, which began in mid-October 2019. Based on the results of monitoring and analysis of atmospheric dynamics, BMKG predicts that in 2020 there will be no El-Nino indication. strong.
